utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What colour would you like to be?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I’d like to be green, but you know you always take it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not true. Any colour’s fine with me. Yeah, I could be a-a combination of blue and yellow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Blue and yellow make green.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then it’s settled.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. Ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good news, we ordered lunch, so we can all stay here and play Lord of the Rings Risk.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, we said that we would play games with you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, we’ll still be playing it tonight, this game can easily take eight hours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, you really thought I’d want to do this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, did you tell him that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did you say it out loud with words?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t want to spend the whole day playing a board game.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you may change your mind when you hear that this is the new expanded edition which contains a more complete map of Middle Earth, now including the Haradwaith Territories.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I will literally race you to the car.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, come on, don’t leave. Just try it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. We’re always doing what you guys want. Just once, it’d be nice if you did something we wanted.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You want to be green?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, they really have tried to like a lot of the same stuff we’re into.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, we do game nights and video game nights and we watch movies with director’s commentary.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, my favourite, George Lucas can talk all the way through Star Wars, I say one word and I’m banished to the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, today Amy and I are deciding what we’re all gonna do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You got it, you girls are in charge.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Now that we’re not playing, you can be green.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And since you’re green this time, I can be it next time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, let’s see. What’s something fun the guys would never take us to do? Oh, I know, we could go horseback riding.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I actually can’t. My hips don’t open wider than 22 degrees. I rode a very thin pony once. On the first bump, just popped right off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, what do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There’s a craft and folk art museum on Wilshire.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, that’s Wilshire’s problem. Come on, you know, there, there’s got to be something fun we could do that the guys will hate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on, why do we have to hate it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Three words, Doctor Who convention.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I did not force you to go to that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You walked out of the house in a fez and bow tie. I went so you didn’t get beat up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wasn’t gonna get beat up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You were, but somehow I held myself back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what you could make us do? Ice-skating. The cold air will trigger Leonard’s asthma and it plays right into my well-known fear of getting flattened by a Zamboni.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now you’re helping them find ways to make us miserable?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m sorry, Leonard, I’m a problem-solver, it’s what I do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I actually can’t go ice-skating. I have unnaturally brittle ankles.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is there any part of your body that’s normal?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, oh, my God, oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Will you please relax?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t take it, dude.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I’m not okay. I feel like I’m gonna jump out of my skin.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I told you not to wax down there. It’s itchy when it grows back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m worried about the New Horizons space probe.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s he talking about?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nine years ago he was part of a team that launched a spacecraft to collect data about Pluto, and it’s finally close enough, so this morning it turned itself on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We hope. The signal has to travel over three billion miles. So it’s gonna be hours before we know if it even survived.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now we get to see him flip out because he’s worried it was demolished by space ice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Space ice is no joke. I can’t even watch Frozen anymore.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh, the philharmonic is playing Beethoven downtown.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Before you say yes, it’s not the movie about the big dog.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How come we can’t think of something we both want to do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because you always pick what we do and I just go along with it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, interesting, we’re being accused of making you do things you don’t like, and here you are, doing the same thing to poor Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You should point out the hypocrisy of that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s what I was doing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that wasn’t clear. Try it again, but this time drive it home with how do you like them apples, Missy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, keep thinking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re making it too complicated. Why not stick to the basics? Go shopping for clothes while Leonard and I sit in those uncomfortable chairs and hold your purses, hmm? I know I’d hate that. Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then, it’s settled?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you say? Sounds kind of perfect.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It does, somehow he managed to take all the fun out of it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, once again, it’s what I do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, another two hours to go. The wait is killing me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. I get it. When I was in the Soyuz capsule returning from the space station, plummeting toward Earth at 17,000 miles per hour…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Before you finish, is this a story about patience and waiting or just another reminder that you went to space?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A story can do two things.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ugh, I feel like I’m gonna have a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You work in pharmaceuticals, don’t you have anything you can give him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: All I have is our new urine flow drug. Won’t help with his anxiety, but it’s so strong, when he pees he’ll fly around the room like he’s got a jet pack.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t stop thinking about it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, worrying won’t have any effect on what happens.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe you need to do something more productive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. If I make this shot in the trash can, the probe will have arrived in perfect working order.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, in addition to being crazy, you’re resting the fate of the mission on your athletic prowess.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The man who crashed his stationary bike.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I didn’t crash it, okay? My playlist was too up-tempo, I got light-headed and I fell off. Okay. It all comes down to this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You happy? Now you can relax.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What kind of scientist are you? Everyone knows you got to make two out of three.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This isn’t so bad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s easy for you to say. Your chair’s not facing the lingerie section. Boy, that’s a lot of panties.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You guys comfy? This might take a while.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand why women insist on making a big production out of buying clothes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you’re right, we should do what you do. Have our mom send us pants from the Walmart in Houston.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They have a man there who understands my personal style.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I’ve got some bad news. There’s no cell service in here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that’s all right. There were plenty of ways to pass the time before smart phones were invented.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll look them up. Son of a biscuit.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not fine. What kind of store in the 21st century doesn’t at least have Wi-Fi? I’m going to call their corporate office. Son of a biscuit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s see, my armies are going to attack the Shire from Buckland. And I roll a five and a three.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. And to defend, I roll two sixes. I win.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boy, double-sixes again. You know, if I hadn’t seen it with my own eyes, I wouldn’t believe it. I wonder how long we’re gonna be stuck here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, but the girls do a lot for us. It’s the least we can do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s true. I suppose it’s only fair we make compromises.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at you, being all mature.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know why you’re so surprised. If there’s one thing I know about after living with you for so many years, it’s how to compromise.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I, I’m sorry? You make compromises for me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: On Earth? In our lives? That, that, that we’re living?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes. I, just yesterday, you had a, a big piece of lettuce stuck in your teeth at lunch. Did I say anything? No. I compromised and kept my mouth shut. Like you should’ve, because everyone was laughing at you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is not a compromise. A compromise is me driving you everywhere because you refuse to learn how.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I learned how. Amy taught me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? Then. then why don’t you do it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, well, it’s scary. And sometimes I get the pedals mixed up. But, more importantly, driving me to work is one of the things that gives your life purpose. I can’t take that away from you, so what do I do? Oh, come on, I’m practically feeding you the answer. I compromise.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, uh, thanks for keeping me company.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m happy to. I think getting out of the apartment will do you good. So, where we headed?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If it’s okay with you, I’d like to go to temple.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Buddy, trust me, you don’t want to convert to Judaism. I mean, I know I make it look cool, but it’s not all briskets and dreidels.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I meant a Hindu temple.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. It’s not like Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, right? Some bald guy with horns isn’t gonna rip my heart out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, that movie’s an imperialist fantasy that makes the followers of a beautiful and peaceful religion look like a bunch of bloodthirsty barbarians.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You love that movie.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s pretty great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m surprised to see you suddenly get religious.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, because I’ve known you for ten years and you’ve never gone to temple, you never talked about believing in God, and last Diwali I watched you eat two pounds of sacred cow at a Brazilian steak house.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Religion is a very personal thing. I do go to temple, I just, I don’t talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, but you’re a scientist.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, as a scientist, you believe the way to understand the universe is through facts and evidence, and now you’re counting on some blue chick with a hundred arms to help you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That is so offensive. Does everything you know about Hinduism come from Indiana Jones?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. There’s also Apu from The Simpsons.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, lots of scientists believe in God. Okay? Newton, uh, Faraday, uh, Pascal, all were believers. Even Einstein was famous for attacking quantum theory on the grounds that God does not play dice with the universe.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, of course he believed in God. he slept with Marilyn Monroe.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually there’s no proof of that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You believe in your religion, I’ll believe in mine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How’s it going in there?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, not really a great outfit for work, unless something opens up in the hookers and whores division. Hey, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do I really force you to do things you don’t want to?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How is it okay?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I promised myself, if I ever got friends, I’d do whatever they said. Really, I’m lucky you found me before a cult did.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you know, that was a long time ago. You’re a different woman now. You’re smart, you’ve got great friends, you’ve got a boyfriend, you’re pretty, you have zero fashion sense, but, anyway, tonight we’re gonna do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Absolutely. You name it, we’re doing it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Basket weaving at the craft museum.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you named it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, here’s another one. I wish that the apple pancake mix was on the top shelf because it starts with an A, but I don’t put it there because I don’t want you breaking one of your little legs when you’re supposed to be making my breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is it my turn to talk about the compromises I make?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wasn’t done, but go ahead. He said, compromising.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because of you, I’m not allowed to adjust the temperature in my own home. I’m not allowed to whistle. I don’t wear shoes that might squeak.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you’re a physicist, not a circus clown.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you realize I don’t live with the woman I love because of you? No other reason. Just you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that true?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, it’s true. The last time I brought it up, you had an emotional breakdown and got on a train and ran away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, given my history on the subject, t seems a little reckless to bring it up now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You have no idea how much you inconvenience the lives of everyone around you. It’s exhausting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what? You think you’re so tolerant, but the truth is you’re mean to me a lot. Yeah, you think that I don’t notice all those sarcastic comments and those eye rolls, but I do. Hmm? I have excellent peripheral vision. On a good day, I can see my ears.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I, I’m sorry if I hurt your feelings. I’ve been holding a lot of this in for a while.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m sorry, too. And if you want to live with Penny, then I think you should.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you mean that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Yeah, just put on your squeaky shoes and eee-eee-eee your way out of my life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, don’t get upset.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not upset. I’m just imagining a world without my best friend in it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not leaving your world. I’m just talking about living across the hall.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I understand. Either way, I want you to know that I’m aware of how difficult I can be. So I just want to say thank you for putting up with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Buddy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How are you guys getting along? What? Why are there tears?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Everything’s fine. We just started talking about living arrangements.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you crazy? You know he’s a flight risk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s exactly what I told him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, we know this is a sensitive subject, and Leonard’s not gonna move out until you’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, what if you did it gradually?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right. How about we start with two nights a week I live with Penny?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about one night and I let you whistle?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When I’m not home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There we go, compromising again. We really are the best.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here we go, my first Hindu temple.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You see behind the fountain, that tower that looks like a pyramid? It’s called a Sikhara. It symbolizes the, the connection between the human and the divine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Huh. I always thought it was mini golf.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right. Shall we?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Just, uh, is there anything I should know before I go in?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like am I dressed okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? So every other place you’ve been, you thought this was fine?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know you’re under a lot of pressure, so I’m gonna let that pass.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry. You’re right. I’m so stressed. But you know what, whenever I walk into that temple I realize that whatever happens, it’s okay. We’re all part of an immense pattern, and though we can’t understand it, we can be happy to know that it’s, it’s working its will through us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Whether you call it God or the universe or the self, we’re all interconnected, and that’s just a beautiful… Son of a bitch, that guy just dinged my car. S, seriously? You were just gonna drive away? Like my life isn’t hard enough right now. A space probe might be destroyed, my parents are going through an awful divorce, the guy who cuts my dog’s hair just gave her bangs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You saw her. She looks like Jim Carrey from Dumb and Dumber.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj, you just got a text. The probe turned on. It’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, good. Namaste, Grandpa.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought this was gonna be boring, but it’s actually kind of fun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t tell Amy that. We’ll be here every Sunday.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, that really is an excellent basket.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not a basket. It’s a soldier’s helmet from 16th century China.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Very nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it looks great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I saw that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, roomie, it’s only one night a week, but it’s a start.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. I’m really proud of Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m proud of him, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (in Penny’s living room)
utterance.content: Can you keep it down? Some of us are trying to sleep out here.
